rev.diff:
Line 30: Line 30:
VMware ThinApp is an [[application virtualization]] solution.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vmware.com/pdf/thinapp_intro.pdf|title=Introduction to VMware ThinApp|date=2008-06-26|accessdate=2008-08-05|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> As with similar products from other vendors, it is able to execute applications without them being installed in the traditional sense by virtualizing resources such as environment variables, files and [[Windows Registry]] keys. The virtual environment presented to the client is a merged view of the underlying physical and virtual resources, thereby allowing the virtualization layer to fool the application into thinking that it is running as if it were fully installed.
VMware ThinApp is an [[application virtualization]] solution.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vmware.com/pdf/thinapp_intro.pdf|title=Introduction to VMware ThinApp|date=2008-06-26|accessdate=2008-08-05|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> As with similar products from other vendors, it is able to execute applications without them being installed in the traditional sense by virtualizing resources such as environment variables, files and [[Windows Registry]] keys. The virtual environment presented to the client is a merged view of the underlying physical and virtual resources, thereby allowing the virtualization layer to fool the application into thinking that it is running as if it were fully installed.
== History ==
== History ==
â
Thinstall was originally developed by Thinstall Inc. but on January 15, 2008, [[VMware]] acquired Thinstall.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinstall.html|title=VMware to Expand Desktop Virtualization Solution with Acquisition of Thinstall|date=January 15, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> VMware later used the code name ''VMware Project North Star'' while the product was in beta.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://communities.vmware.com/community/beta/northstar|title=VMwareÂ® ThinApp (Project North Star/Thinstall) Release Candidate|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> On June 10, 2008, VMware announced that the final name for the product was going to be ''VMware ThinApp''.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinapp_4.html|title=VMware Launches ThinApp 4.0 to Run Virtually Any Application on Any Windows Operating System without Conflict|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref>
+
Thinstall was originally developed by Thinstall Inc. but on January 15, 2008, [[VMware]] acquired Thinstall.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinstall.html|title=VMware to Expand Desktop Virtualization Solution with Acquisition of Thinstall|date=January 15, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> VMware later used the code name ''VMware Project North Star'' while the product was in beta.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://communities.vmware.com/community/beta/northstar|title=VMwareÂ® ThinApp (Project North Star/Thinstall) Release Candidate|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> On June 10, 2008, VMware announced that the final name for the product was going to be ''VMware ThinApp''.<ref>{{cite press release|url=http://www.vmware.com/company/news/releases/thinapp_4.html|title=VMware Launches ThinApp 4.0 to Run Virtually Any Application on Any Windows Operating System without Conflict|date=June 10, 2008|accessdate=2008-06-11|publisher=[[VMware]]}}</ref> <br>
â
+
The trial versin of ''Thinstall'' was previously only available to persons working for a company.<ref>[http://www.thinstall.com/products/virtualization_suite_dl.php VMware ThinApp Application Virtualization Platform: IT Management Solutions<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>, but now VMware offers a trial to anyone interested.<ref>http://www.vmware.com/go/trythinapp</ref>
â
=== Changes since acquisition by VMware ===
  â
* Trial version is available to everyone (previously only available to persons working for a company).<ref>[http://www.thinstall.com/products/virtualization_suite_dl.php VMware ThinApp Application Virtualization Platform: IT Management Solutions<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
